protocol_name: Ligation Protocol with T4 DNA Ligase (M0202)
protocol_name_html: Ligation Protocol with T4 DNA Ligase (M0202)
description: Please see the NEB website for more information.

components.data: Thaw the T4 DNA Ligase Buffer and resuspended at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.annotation: A useful thing to do is to alicuote the 10x buffer less concentrated so when thawing the DTT gets soluble more easily.

source_data.reagent_name: T4 DNA Ligase Reaction Buffer - 6.0 ml

components.data:
Set up the reaction in a microcentrifuge tube on ice. (T4 DNA Ligase should be added last.)

 

COMPONENT 20 μl REACTION
T4 DNA Ligase Buffer (10X)* 2 μl
Vector DNA (4 kb) 50 ng (0.020 pmol)
Insert DNA (1 kb) 37.5 ng (0.060 pmol)
Nuclease-free water to 20 μl
T4 DNA Ligase  1 μl
components.name: Description

source_data.annotation:
T4 DNA Ligase should be added last.

 

Note that the table shows a ligation using a molar ratio of 1:3 vector to insert for the indicated DNA sizes.

 

Use NEBioCalculator to calculate molar ratios.

source_data.description: This is the reaction for the "Ligation Protocol with T4 DNA Ligase"

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of T4 DNA Ligase Reaction
Annotation on step 2 of T4 DNA Ligase Reaction
source_data.annotation:
recommended vector concentration 50ng=0.05ug
my linearized vector concentration= 5ug/ml=0.005ug/ul
1ul vector=0.005ug
how many ul of vector to make up 0.05ug?
(0.05ugx1ul)/0.005ug=10ul
thus, 10ul of vector should be added into ligation reaction.

components.data: Gently mix the reaction by pipetting up and down and microfuge briefly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently mix the reaction by pipetting up and down and microfuge briefly.

components.data: For cohesive (sticky) ends, incubate at 16°C overnight or room temperature for 10 minutes. For blunt ends or single base overhangs, incubate at 16°C overnight or room temperature for 2 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For cohesive (sticky) ends, incubate at 16°C overnight or room temperature for 10 minutes. For blunt ends or single base overhangs, incubate at 16°C overnight or room temperature for 2 hours.

comments.name: New England  Biolabs
comments.comment_text:
Dear Abhilek,

Thank you for your question.  Here is the response from NEB Technical Support:  We recommend heat inactivation for use with T4 Ligase that does not contain PEG in the buffer. If you heat inactivate in the presence of PEG, the transformation efficiency will be reduced.
Sincerely,
Mary

 

Should you need further assistance, please contact NEB technical support directly at 1-800-NEB-LABS or info@neb.com.  Thank you!
comments.body:
Dear Abhilek,

Thank you for your question.  Here is the response from NEB Technical Support:  We recommend heat inactivation for use with T4 Ligase that does not contain PEG in the buffer. If you heat inactivate in the presence of PEG, the transformation efficiency will be reduced.
Sincerely,
Mary

 

Should you need further assistance, please contact NEB technical support directly at 1-800-NEB-LABS or info@neb.com.  Thank you!

components.data: Chill on ice and transform 1-5 μl of the reaction into 50 μl competent cells.
components.name: Description
